# Gaurab Chhetri — Portfolio & Dev Logs

> Undergraduate Researcher in Computer Science at Texas State University (AIT Lab). I work on AI, data mining, and full-stack web development, building end-to-end systems that mix machine learning with solid engineering. Focus areas: applied AI/ML, transportation research, data engineering, and web development.

## About

- **Current Role**: Undergraduate Researcher at AIT Lab, Texas State University (San Marcos, TX)
- **Domains**: Applied AI/ML, Transportation Engineering, Data Science, Full-Stack Web Development
- **Approach**: Build end-to-end systems, iterate fast, document clearly, reduce complexity
- **Education**: B.S. Computer Science, Texas State University (Expected May 2028)

## Site Structure & Navigation

- **Home** (`/`): Start here for overview — experience, education, featured projects, recent dev logs, research publications
- **Projects** (`/projects`): Detailed project write-ups with context, tech stack, and outcomes
- **Dev Logs** (`/devLogs`): Short essays and notes on building, learnings, and development philosophy
- **Tools** (`/minitools`): Interactive utilities (CSV → LaTeX converter, word counter)

## Key Projects

- **ComputeNepal**: Community portal for computing resources and learning
- **ScholarNest**: Education-focused platform and supporting tools
- **CognitiveSky**: Scalable sentiment analysis framework for decentralized social media (Bluesky)
- **VidXiv**: Video-centric exploration and analysis platform

## Research & Publications

8+ publications on AI/ML, transportation engineering, and computational methods. Topics include: sentiment analysis, crash analytics, state space models (Mamba), quantum computing, and tiny ML. See homepage for complete list with abstracts and links.

## Where to Look Next

- **For project details**: Visit `/projects` or individual project pages
- **For development insights**: Check `/devLogs` for essays on building and learnings
- **For research work**: See publications section on homepage with full abstracts
- **For tools**: Explore `/minitools` for interactive utilities
